title: There's New Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse Merch for Every Spider-Person
description:
The sheer amount of Spidey variants should tell you enough about how stacked the new Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse merch collections are.

title: RWBY x Justice League's Meghan Fitzmartin on the Fun of Multiverses
description:
DC Comics heroes are no stranger to big crossovers that often see them hopping into other timelines or even other universes. Over the decades, marquee characters like Batman and Wonder Woman have wound up crossing paths with the likes of the Avengers, Ninja Turtles, and Epic Games’ Fortnite. The most recent of the…

title: Arizona Drought Pushes Phoenix to Hit Pause on Construction Projects
description:
Arizona officials may not be able to approve new construction in some of the fastest-growing parts of the Phoenix metropolitan area that rely on groundwater in response to dwindling supply. the Associated Press reported.

title: Activision Blizzard Fires World of Warcraft Game Designer for Making Fun of Corporate Greed
description:
Activision Blizzard leaders didn’t appreciate jokes that poked fun at greedy corporate execs via a conniving, scampering, and loot-obsessed character in World of Warcraft, so much so they fired the game designer who wrote the little goblin’s voice lines.

title: 10 Killer Robert Englund Horror Roles Beyond Nightmare on Elm Street
description:
With Hollywood Dreams & Nightmares: The Robert Englund Story out this week, there’s no better time to celebrate the horror icon by revisiting some of his best performances. While fans will immediately think of a certain razor-fingered dream stalker, as the documentary reminds us, there’s quite a bit more to Englund’s…

title: Private Ax-2 Astronauts Reflect on Seeing Earth From Space for the First Time
description:
Following their brief stint on board the International Space Station (ISS), Axiom Space’s Mission 2 (Ax-2) crew is back on Earth with an altered view of the planet that we call home.

title: The Flash Filmmakers Talk the Long, Controversial Road to Release
description:
The year is 2014. Warner Bros. makes a superhero-sized splash and announces not just that Justice League, Wonder Woman, and Aquaman movies are coming, but that a Flash movie is coming and the Flash will be played by Ezra Miller.

Read more...

title: Scientists Successfully Transmit Space-Based Solar Power to Earth for the First Time
description:
The California Institute of Technology has big news for space-based power. Researchers at the university have reportedly beamed solar power from space to Earth without a single wire—and they say it’s a first.

Read more...

title: Webb Takes Portrait of Star-Studded Barred Galaxy
description:
The Webb Space Telescope is on a tear, imaging regions of star formation across the cosmos. Its latest target? The barred spiral galaxy NGC 5068—a bedazzled conglomeration of gas and stars 17 million light-years from Earth.

Read more...

title: Woman Who Refused TB Treatment Finally Arrested, Faces at Least 45 Days in Jail
description:
A Washington woman who refused to treat her tuberculosis for at least two years has finally been taken into custody, local health officials reported this week. The woman repeatedly ignored court orders to seek treatment and stay away from others, even visiting a casino earlier this year. She is now being detained in a…

Read more...

title: Apple Finally Retiring Original 12-Inch MacBook By End of June
description:
Say goodbye to the original 12-inch MacBook. Ride on home now, you beautiful yet flawed darling. According to an internal memo seen by MacRumors, which regularly reports on Apple products becoming obsolete, the 12-inch MacBook will be put to rest after a storied near-eight year career on June 30.

Read more...

title: Jedi Survivor Players, You're Not Using the Best Lightsaber Stance
description:
Sometimes it’s not fair to tell people they’re playing a video game wrong—in fact, it’s more often than not unfair to tell people they’re playing a video game wrong. But Star Wars fans, I beg of you, as you gallivant through the galaxy in Jedi Survivor, use something other than the single lightsaber.

title: Don't Store Your Money on Venmo, U.S. Govt Agency Warns
description:
Venmo, Cash App, and PayPal users are being warned not to store money on the apps long-term, the watchdog Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) said on Thursday, following Silicon Valley Bank, Signature Bank, and First Republic Bank’s failure when customers tried to withdraw money en masse. CFPB is worried about…

title: Sweeping Mosaic Map of Mars Released to Celebrate Anniversary of Orbiter Launch
description:
Arresting views of Mars taken from high above the planet’s surface by the Mars Express orbiter have been stitched into a mosaic image of the planet’s surface.

title: Ice Age North Americans Were Freshwater Fishers, New Evidence Suggests
description:
Archaeologists working in central Alaska have found over 1,000 fish specimens that potentially indicate the early presence of subsistence farming among Ice Age North Americans.

Read more...

title: The Tom Holland Wink You May Have Missed in Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse
description:
Watching Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse, there was a scene where I jumped out of my seat. Actually, if we’re being honest, there were several moments where that happened, but one in particular was so random, so unexpected, so subtly connected to the Spider-Man universe, and so in tune with my personal interests,…

title: What's The Point of Expanding Album Covers with AI?
description:
The beauty of a good album cover is that it can perfectly encapsulate the mood of a dozen or so songs in a single image or illustration—and that’s a difficult feat when you only have a square-sized canvas to work with. In order to depict the world that an album takes place in, musicians and their designated team of…

title: $165 Airplane Face Rest Promises a More Comfortable Flight
description:
The best way to spend $165 to sleep better on a flight is to put that money towards a seat upgrade, but if you’re a frequent flier, those extra fees can quickly add up. Another solution is the TruRest, a foldaway contraption that promises to support your body in a forward leaning position, letting you supposedly sleep…

Read more...

title: Embrace the Mutant Mayhem With Playmates' Villainous New TMNT Toys
description:
A new Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles movie means new TMNT merch—and thanks to the gorgeous animated stylings of Mutant Mayhem, Playmates’ accompanying toys look as slick and as stylish as their movie counterparts. As this fresh take on the turtle brothers gets ready for the spotlight, we’ve got a look at some of the…

title: Mutant Monsters Are Here, and Only The Rock Gods of Jackson, Tennessee Can Save Us
description:
As disciples of the riff know, it’s a long way to the top if you wanna rock ‘n’ roll—a quest made even more difficult when annoyances like high school and monsters get in the way. A new Dark Horse release, The Rock Gods of Jackson, Tennessee, brings this adventure to life, and io9 has a fun preview to share today.

Read more...

title: Nintendo Duck Hunt Gun Was Used to Hold Up Convenience Store for $300
description:
A South Carolina man allegedly robbed a convenience store using a fake 1980s Nintendo gun, getting away with $300 in cash. York County deputies reported that 25-year-old David Joseph Dalesandro entered the convenience store at about 5:45 p.m. on Tuesday wearing a mask, wig, and hoodie sweatshirt when police say he…

title: Sci-Fantasy Martial Arts Novel The Combat Codes Gets a JRPG-Inspired Trailer
description:
The first book in an “action-packed science fantasy series,” The Combat Codes takes place in a world where individual fighters take to rings to fight for their nation rather than risk all-out war. Alexander Darwin crafts a lone-wolf-and-cub mentor/mentee pair with Murray and Cego as he merges politics and intensely…

title: Twitter Loses Its Second Trust and Safety Head Under Elon Musk's Reign
description:
Twitter’s head of trust and safety, former diehard Elon Musk fan Ella Irwin, publicly resigned from her position Thursday just hours after her boss publicly rebuked his own content moderation team. Irwin’s staff had taken action against a transphobic film by Ben Shapiro’s Daily Wire.

Read more...

title: Hayao Miyazaki's New Film Is Out Next Month, And You Won't See Any of It Before That
description:
In a streamed video interview earlier today Toshio Suzuki, the co-founder and former president of Studio Ghibli who has been a producer on nearly every Ghibli film you can think of, revealed that there would be no additional images released for the newest Ghibli film, How Do You Live? The poster, included below, will…

Read more...

title: Boeing Calls Off Its First Crewed Starliner Flight Due to Major Safety Issues
description:
Just when you thought the saga of Boeing’s Starliner program couldn’t get any worse, it just did. The first crewed test flight of Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner has been delayed indefinitely due to two serious issues with the crew vehicle meant to transport NASA astronauts to the International Space Station (ISS).

Read more...

title: J. Michael Straczynski Is Returning to Marvel For a New Captain America Run
description:
16 years ago, J. Michael Straczynski inadvertantly gave the Marvel Comics world one of the all time great Captain America moments in the pages of his Civil War-era run on Amazing Spider-Man. Now, it’s time for him to move: in a major return to the publisher, to put the spotlight on Steve Rogers for real in a brand new…

Read more...

title: How a Journalist Is Using Twitch Streams of Impossible Games to Counter Sexist Jerks
description:
Jessica Body isn’t your typical Twitch steamer. The Chicago resident spends half of her days working as a multimedia editor at the magazine Popular Science, where she’s spent years helping craft health and science coverage, including at the height of the coronavirus pandemic. When she’s not working as a journalist,…

Read more...

title: Meet Mayichi, the Twitch Streamer Unafraid to Fight for Her Place in a Male-Dominated World
description:
Come rain or shine, Twitch streamer and gamer Mayichi always welcomes her community with the same message: “Hi beautiful people. The stream is starting.” The message, simple and sweet, largely reflects the philosophy she applies to her channel, where she aims to make people feel like family and have a good time while…

Read more...

title: Video Game Voice Actors Say AI Has Put Their Jobs 'On the Chopping Block'
description:
For those who play enough games, a voice actor’s every sound and inflection is like hearing the banter of a forgotten friend, sending off firecrackers of recognition in the brain. In video games, despite the recent obsession of graphical fidelity down to each and every facial pore, players get to know their favorite…

Read more...

title: Xbox's First Wireless Arcade Stick Arrives Just in Time For Street Fighter 6
description:
They say a bad carpenter always blames their tools, but you can’t build a table with a knife and spoon. A lot of times, a good tool can enhance a user’s skills. That’s definitely the case with gaming, so 8BitDo has created an updated version of its Arcade Stick with a facelift and support for recent Xbox models.

Read more...

title: Mark Zuckerberg Mandates Meta Employees Return to the Office Three Days a Week
description:
Meta announced it is requiring employees to come back to the office at least three days a week starting on September 5. The company clarified that employees working in remote positions are exempt from the hybrid work requirement.

Read more...

title: China Is Digging a Big Frickin' Hole 33,000 Feet Into the Earth
description:
China has seemingly set off on a journey into the center of the earth. This week the country has begun digging what will eventually become the deepest hole in China’s history to test drilling technology and further understand the Earth’s underground structure, Bloomberg reported.

Read more...

title: Netflix Caves After Writer’s Union Opposes Executive Pay Bumps
description:
As the Writers Guild of America continues to strike for fair wages and against the looming threat of AI, one of the largest streaming services—Netflix—might have just heard their battle cry against executives.

description:
Get a look at Good Omens season 2's new opening titles. It’s going to be a while before The Batman 2 starts filming. Plus, even more Transformers: Rise of the Beasts posters, and the CW teases what’s next on Riverdale, Superman & Lois, and more. Spoilers, away!

title: Artifact’s AI Will Rewrite Clickbaity Headlines, Though Don’t You Dare Rework Mine
description:
Tired of search engine optimization run amok? After allowing users to flag some articles as clickbait, the Artifact news app now says it wants users to mark clickbait headlines they come across so it can rewrite the title text using AI. Hell, if enough users also report the same headline, Artifact will then display…

Read more...

title: Soft Pastel Joy-Cons Are Here to Make You Forget All Your Drift-Induced Rage
description:
If you’ve been a devoted Switch player long enough, you know that its Joy-Con controllers will eventually, and sometimes repeatedly, need replacing. The next time your Joy-Cons start to exhibit joystick drift, Nintendo hopes some soft new pastel color options for the Joy-Cons will help soften your frustrations.

Read more...

title: Hundreds of One-Dimensional Strands Found Lurking in Our Galaxy's Core
description:
Behold, the stringy, rainbowesque melange of one-dimensional structures hidden in plain sight across the galactic center. Or should we say plane sight? The tendrils measure 5 to 150 light-years in length, and now a team of scientists has found filaments that stretch out parallel to the galactic plane surrounding the…

title: What Those Icons in Your Browser’s Address Bar Actually Mean
description:
Take a look at the address bar of the best internet browsers and you’ll notice a number of icons in there. You might not have given them a whole lot of thought, but they can tell you a lot about the website that you’re on and what you can do with it—and as Google Chrome is changing one of those icons soon, it’s a good…

title: How To Use Stage Manager To Keep Your Mac and iPad Screens Organized
description:
Stage Manager is new to the latest versions of iPadOS and macOS, bringing a windowed, desktop-style experience to your iPad and (in theory) a more intuitive and convenient way of multitasking on both iPads and Macs. If you’re yet to switch from your normal way of working to the Stage Manager experience, here’s what’s…

title: Please Don’t Make These 7 Nasty ChatGPT-Generated Vegan Recipes
description:
If the artificial intelligence hypebeasts are to be believed, ChatGPT-styled large language models are on the cusp of radically altering the global workforce, gutting entire industries, and, quite possibly, eliminating life on earth as we know it. Just don’t ask it to prepare you a basic meal or a palatable cocktail.

Read more...

title: Publisher Drops Author After TikTok Backlash and GoodReads Review Bombing
description:
Angry readers flooded TikTok and the GoodReads page of an author’s forthcoming book with one-star reviews after the author attacked one particular reviewer for rating the novel four out of five stars. GoodReads seems to have paused reviews of the book in response, freezing the page as it was on Wednesday. The book’s…
